text.p: These are the leading stories in the Botswana press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The family of a young man shot by a member of the special security police during riots in 1995 is claiming a million pula from the government. A policeman was found guilty and sentenced to 12 years imprisonment, reduced to five years on appeal, for the shooting.

- The opposition Botswana National Front is tipped by a democracy poll to win an upcoming by-election in rural Ngwaketse. The poll, by the University of Botswana, says while voters might not know political candidates well, they are clear on their party preferences.
- Politial interference in the work of the Directorate of Corruption and Economic Crime is forcing former British police officers who founded the department to leave.
